intro: Osbeckia lineolata, commonly known as the narrow-veined willow herb, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Osbeckia lineolata is often found in dry, sandy soils along roadsides and in disturbed areas. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
